newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Scania shares rise on brighter H2 outlook.
newsitem.headline: Scania shares rise on brighter H2 outlook.

text.p: Shares in Swedish truck maker Scania rose on Monday after the company posted a slightly lower than expected profit after financial items for the first half of 1997 of 1.35 billion crowns but saw a brighter second half.
At 1115 GMT Scania shares were 5.5 higher at 230.5 crowns. The share was trading 0.5 crowns higher ahead of the result and rose as much as seven crowns after the report.
"I think comments about the truck market improving in the second half are pushing the price up," said Swedbank analyst Mats Liss.
Scania said it expected this improved order intake to have a positive effect on sales in the second half of 1997.
The market has expected Scania to post a profit after financial items of 1.43 billion crowns compared to 2.10 billion crowns in the same period a year ago.
